Context:
Program Name: Cloud Computing Technologies
Code: T465
Credential: Ontario College Graduate Certificate
Duration: 3 Semesters
Starting Months: January, September
Domestic Tuition: $4,316.00
International Tuition: $18,019.00
Location: Casa Loma Campus
Program Level: Postgraduate
Method of Study: Full-time
Program Offerings:
- 2023-2024
- 2024-2025
Centre: Arts, Design & Information Technology
School: Computer Technology
Experiential Learning: Mandatory Co-op or Work Integrated Project
Fall 2023 Delivery: Semester 1: On Campus (Winter: Not provided)
Program Description: The Cloud Computing Technologies program provides students with a comprehensive and in-depth technical base through courses in system and network administration, cloud productivity tools, cloud computing design and implementation, and cloud computing security from Microsoft 365, Microsoft Azure and Amazon AWS. Upon completion of this program, graduates will possess the cloud computing design, administration and troubleshooting skills necessary to support any business and attract employers from all over the world.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Cloud Computing Technologies Program (Postgraduate) T465 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Extracted Information:

1. The program is offered at George Brown College.
2. Students gain hands-on experience using technologies in real-world cloud computing scenarios through lab activities and projects.
3. An optional work-integrated learning field placement is available for those who are not currently employed in IT.
4. The college aims to meet the market demand by educating IT professionals in all aspects of computer systems from on-premises to cloud computing due to growing global demand and technical skills shortages.
5. Technology Requirements:
   - Students need a personal computer with a minimum of 16GB RAM (recommended 32GB), 512 GB SSD Hard Drive, Quad-core i7 2.4GHz or better processor, and a webcam.
6. In semester 3, students complete a Work Integrated Project or are eligible for co-op.
7. Career Options:
   - Junior cloud computing engineer
   - Data engineer/Data scientist
   - Cloud solutions engineer
   - Cloud security developer
8. Potential educational pathways after graduation include Computer System Technicians (T141), Computer Systems Technology (T147), Computer Programming and Analysis (T177), Cyber Security (T433), Wireless networking (T411).
9. Individuals from industry can also join this program to advance their careers.
10. Graduates may choose to directly enter the workforce or pursue additional programs and third-party certifications from Amazon and Microsoft.
11. Required Courses in Semester 1: CLCT 4000 Desktop Operating Systems, CLCT 4001 Advanced Linux, CLCT 4002 Network Fundamentals, and CLCT 4003 (not fully listed).
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Cloud Computing Technologies Program (Postgraduate) T465 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Program Offered:
- Advanced Linux (CLCT 4002)
- Network Fundamentals (CLCT 4003)
- Windows Server Infrastructure Services (CLCT 4004)
- Microsoft 365 Identity and Services I: Enterprise Administration (CLCT 4004)
- Microsoft 365 Identity and Services II: Enterprise Mobility and Security (CLCT 4005)
- Microsoft Azure I: Azure Administrator (CLCT 4006)
- Microsoft Azure II: Azure Architect (CLCT 4007)
- Microsoft Azure Security (CLCT 4008)
- AWS I: Cloud Practitioner (CLCT 4009)
- AWS II: Solutions Architect (CLCT 4010)
- AWS Security (CLCT 4011)

Semesters:
- Semester 2
- Semester 3

Courses in Semester 2:
- Course Code: CLCT 4002, 4003, 4004, 4005, 4006, 4007, 4009, 4010

Prerequisites:
- CLCT 4006 for Microsoft Azure I: Azure Administrator and Microsoft Azure II: Azure Architect
- COMP 4064 for Career Planning and Portfolio Development in Semester 3

Career Planning and Portfolio Development (COMP 4064) is offered in Semester 3.

Learning Outcomes:
- Create secure solutions that support highly available micro-services that meet client needs.
- Implement enterprise level applications in hosted cloud environments that respond to client needs and business practices.
- Architect and deploy fault tolerant solutions within cloud computing platforms to solve identified business requirements.
- Automate security and resources for applications by using cloud computing tools to mitigate risk for organizations and protect assets.
- Design and test code-based solutions to cloud computing problems that ensure security in depth.
- Assess the viability of developing, deploying, maintaining and securing cloud computing solutions using a variety of resiliency testing tools.
- Create and defend cloud-computing strategies used to solve identified business needs on behalf of a client.
- Install and monitor a database management system on the cloud in response to specified requirements.
- Design, develop, configure, troubleshoot, maintain, and upgrade computing systems and network infrastructures for the cloud.

Tuition & Fees:
- Domestic Tuition: $4,316.00 ‡
- International Tuition: $18,019.00 ‡

Note: ‡ Amounts listed are the total tuition, materials, student service and ancillary fees for the first two semesters of the program starting in Fall 2022. Fees are subject to change for programs starting in Fall 2023 and at later dates.

Context: The estimated total of tuition, materials, student service and ancillary fees for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2023 is subject to board approval. Tuition fees are estimated based on prior years, while material, student service and ancillary fees are estimated. Semester 3 fees consist of a flat fee of $500 for co-op placement or work-integrated project and are to be paid separately. International Students should refer to the International Fees and Related Costs page for more information. The program is approved for OSAP funding for applicants who meet eligibility criteria. Admission Requirements include a Bachelor's degree or Advanced Diploma in mathematics, business, computer science, economics, engineering, or science, with proof of English language proficiency for international students. Course exemptions may be granted based on college or university credits. Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges and international students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System. Applicants with international transcripts who do not provide English proficiency test results must take the George Brown College English assessment. The information contained in this website is subject to change without notice. Please visit the respective pages for more details on English Proficiency, Transfer Guide, Country-specific admission requirements, and Application process.
